bills.title: BOWSER Act
bills.description: Would repeal the Home Rule Act

bills.title: Washington, D.C. Residents Voting Act
bills.description: Would retrocede D.C. to Maryland

bills.title: Matthew Lawrence Perna Act of 2025
bills.description: Would, among other things, allow an individual charged with committing a crime in D.C. to move the trial to the individual's home state

bills.title: Protecting Our Nation's Capital Emergency Act of 2025
bills.description: Would repeal police discipline provisions of the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Police Reform
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry out the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Youth Rehabilitation
bills.description: Would repeal provisions of the Youth Rehabilitation Amendment Act of 2018

bills.title: District of Columbia Federal Immigration Compliance Act
bills.description: Would require D.C. to cooperate with federal immigration agencies

bills.title: DC CRIMES Act of 2025
bills.description: Would prohibit the D.C. Council from changing criminal penalties, amend the Youth Rehabilitation Amendment Act of 2018 and require D.C. to publicly post information about juvenile crime

bills.title: Crime Emergency Extension Resolution
bills.description: To extend the emergency determined by the President on August 11, 2025, in the Executive Order titled "Declaring a crime emergency in the District of Columbia"

bills.title: Presidential Emergency Extension Amendment
bills.description: Would amend Section 740 of the Home Rule Act to permit the president to declare an emergency for 180 days, and the amendment would be retroactive to an emergency declared before enactment

bills.title: Keep Offenders Off Our Streets Act
bills.description: Would prohibit the Council from enacting, and the mayor from enforcing, a law that permits a defendant to be released pretrial without a secured appearance bond, and prohibits the Council from ever enacting such a law

bills.title: Ending Cashless Bail in Our Nation's Capital Act
bills.description: Would require D.C. to allow cash bail, as well as require D.C. to have an automatic presumption of pretrial detention, for certain crimes

bills.title: Juvenile Charging Age Reduction
bills.description: Would lower the age at which a minor may be charged as an adult

bills.title: District of Columbia Policing Protection Act
bills.description: Would weaken limitations on vehicular pursuits by police officers

bills.title: CLEAN DC Act
bills.description: Would repeal the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: Capital Emergency Control Act of 2025
bills.description: Would amend section 740 of the Home Rule Act to allow the president to extend emergency control of the D.C. police department for additional 30-day periods indefinitely

bills.title: District of Columbia Cash Bail Reform Act
bills.description: Would require pretrial detention and a secured appearance bond for certain crimes

bills.title: Strong Sentences for Safer D.C. Streets Act
bills.description: Would increase existing and establish new mandatory minimums

bills.title: Second Chance and Incarceration Reduction Repeal
bills.description: Would repeal the Second Chance Amendment Act of 2022 and the Incarceration Reduction Amendment Act of 2016

bills.title: Clean and Managed Public Spaces Act
bills.description: Would impose criminal penalties for camping on public property

bills.title: Public Property Camping Penalties
bills.description: Would impose criminal penalties for camping on public property

bills.title: JUSTICE in D.C. Act
bills.description: Would repeal the Second Look Amendment Act of 2022 and the Incarceration Reduction Amendment Act of 2016 and provide funding for victim services

bills.title: District of Columbia Judicial Nominations Reform Act
bills.description: Would abolish the Judicial Nomination Commission

bills.title: District of Columbia Attorney General Appointment Reform Act
bills.description: Would grant the president authority to appoint the Attorney General

bills.title: Noncitizen Voting Prohibition
bills.description: Would prohibit noncitizens from voting in D.C. and repeal the Local Resident Voting Rights Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: District of Columbia One Vote One Choice Act
bills.description: Would prohibit ranked choice voting

bills.title: Noncitizen Voting Budget Amendment
bills.description: Amendment to fiscal year 2025 budget resolution that would establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to prohibiting or limiting noncitizen voting

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Noncitizen Voting
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement the Local Resident Voting Rights Amendment Act of 2022 or any activities related to enrolling or registering noncitizens into voter rolls for local elections

bills.title: Proving Residency for Overseas Voter Eligibility Act
bills.description: Would deem as D.C. residents for purposes of federal elections in D.C. nonmilitary overseas voters who can't prove residency in the state in which they are seeking to vote in a federal election

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Vehicle Emissions
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to enforce the rule relating to 'Adoption of California Vehicle Emission Standards'

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Oil & Gas Protection
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement or enforce provisions of the Consumer Protection Act against oil and gas companies for environmental claims

bills.title: No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act of 2025
bills.description: Would, among other things, permanently prohibit D.C. funds approved by Congress from being used for abortion, prohibit D.C. employees from providing an abortion and prohibit abortion in D.C. facilities

bills.title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations 2025 - Abortion
bills.description: Prohibited use of funds on abortion

bills.title: Insurance Regulation Disapproval Resolution
bills.description: Disapproval resolution on the Insurance Regulation Amendment Act of 2024 (reproductive health care and gender-affirming care)

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Abortion
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds for abortion

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Reproductive Health Non-Discrimination
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry out the Reproductive Health Non-Discrimination Amendment Act of 2014

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Death with Dignity
bills.description: Would repeal the Death with Dignity Act of 2016 and purports to prohibit enactment of a similar law

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - COVID Mandates
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement, administer or enforce any COVIDâ€“19 mask or vaccine mandate

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Insurance Regulation
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to implement the Insurance Regulation Amendment Act of 2024 (reproductive health care and gender-affirming care)

bills.title: Chloe Cole Act
bills.description: Would, among other things, prohibit gender affirming care for children within D.C.

bills.title: Protecting Women's Private Spaces Act
bills.description: Would prohibit an individual from accessing or using a single-sex facility on government property other than those corresponding to the biological sex of such individual

bills.title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations 2025 - Marijuana
bills.description: Prohibited using of funds on commercializing recreational marijuana

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Marijuana
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to commercialize recreational marijuana

bills.title: Open Meetings Clarification Repeal
bills.description: Would repeal the Open Meetings Clarification Emergency Amendment Act of 2025

bills.title: Open Meetings Clarification Disapproval Resolution
bills.description: Disapproval resolution on the Open Meetings Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 2025

bills.title: Oswaldo Paya Way Designation
bills.description: Would designate the area between the intersections of 16th Street, Northwest and Fuller Street, Northwest and 16th Street, Northwest and Euclid Street, Northwest as "Oswaldo Paya Way"

bills.title: Alexi Navalny Way Designation
bills.description: Would designate the area of Sumner Row between 16th Street Northwest and L Street Northwest as "Alexi Navalny Way"

bills.title: Black Lives Matter Plaza Removal
bills.description: Would withhold 50 percent of federal highway funds unless the mayor removes the phrase Black Lives Matter from the street symbolically designated as Black Lives Matter Plaza, redesignates such street as Liberty Plaza, and removes such phrase from each website, document, and other material

bills.title: Jimmy Lai Way Designation
bills.description: To designate the area between the intersections of 18th Street Northwest and Church Street Northwest, and 18th Street Northwest and P Street Northwest as "Jimmy Lai Way"

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Right Turn on Red
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to enact or carry out any law that prohibits motorists from making right turns on red, including the Safer Streets Amendment Act of 2022

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Traffic Cameras
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry the automated traffic enforcement law

bills.title: Traffic Camera Repeal Amendment
bills.description: Amendment that would repeal the automated traffic enforcement law

bills.title: Right Turn Prohibition Repeal Amendment
bills.description: Amendment that would repeal the law that prohibits right turns on red

bills.title: Stop DC CAMERA Act
bills.description: Would repeal the automated traffic enforcement law and the law prohibiting right turns on red

bills.title: Charlie Kirk Patriot Way Designation
bills.description: To designate the area of H Street Northwest between Connecticut Avenue Northwest and Vermont Avenue Northwest in Washington, District of Columbia, as "Charlie Kirk Patriot Way"

bills.title: Freedom to Petition the Government Act
bills.description: Would treat meetings nonprofits hold with federal officials in D.C. as activities not constituting doing business in D.C. for purposes of determining whether organizations are required to register with D.C.

bills.title: Families' Rights and Responsibilities Act
bills.description: Would prohibit the government from substantially burdening the fundamental right of parents to direct the upbringing, education and health care of their children without demonstrating that the infringement is required by a compelling governmental interest of the highest order as applied to the parent and the child and is the least restrictive means of furthering that compelling governmental interest

bills.title: Legislative Authority Budget Amendment
bills.description: Amendment to fiscal year 2025 budget resolution that would establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund "relating to Congress reasserting legislative authority over the District of Columbia"

bills.title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations 2025 - Budget Cut
bills.description: Cut the fiscal year 2025 local budget by more than $1 billion

bills.title: Make American Flags in America Act of 2025
bills.description: Would prohibit the purchase or display of U.S. flags not made in America

bills.title: Agency Interpretation Deference Prohibition
bills.description: Would prohibit requiring tribunals in court or administrative proceedings to defer to the mayor's interpretation of statutes and regulations and repeal the Review of Agency Action Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 2024

bills.title: Delivering On Government Efficiency in Spending Act
bills.description: Would treat D.C. as a federal agency for purposes of the Treasury disbursement system

bills.title: District of Columbia Sister City Integrity Act
bills.description: Would prohibit entering into or maintaining a sister city relationship with a jurisdiction located in a foreign adversary country

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Anti-SLAPP
bills.description: Would repeal Section 5 of the Corrections Oversight Improvement Omnibus Amendment Act of 2022 (exemptions to anti-Strategic Lawsuits Against Public Participation law)

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Concealed Carry
bills.description: Would provide that an individual who has a valid weapons carry permit from any state or territory may possess and carry a concealed handgun, magazine and ammunition in an area governed by D.C. or the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority

bills.title: Emergency Bill Disapproval Resolution Act
bills.description: Would make emergency bills subject to disapproval resolutions

bills.title: Congressional Concealed Carry in D.C.
bills.description: Would permit members of Congress who are authorized to carry a concealed gun in their state to carry in D.C.

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Sister Cities China
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to plan, support, or implement a sister city relationship with a city in China

bills.title: FY 2026 D.C. Appropriations - Shield Law
bills.description: Would prohibit the use of funds to carry out title I or title II of the Human Rights Sanctuary Amendment Act of 2022 (shield law)

bills.title: District of Columbia Home Rule Improvement Act
bills.description: Would make both civil and criminal bills enacted by D.C. subject to a 60-legislative-day review period, permit a disapproval resolution to disapprove individual provisions of a bill enacted by D.C., prohibit D.C. from enacting a bill that is substantially the same as a bill that has been subject to an enacted disapproval resolution, prohibit D.C. from withdrawing a bill that is undergoing the congressional review period, subject successive emergency bills to a congressional review period and subject executive orders and regulations issued by the mayor and executive branch agencies, respectively, to a congressional review period, and require the mayor and Council chair to testify annually before House and Senate committees

bills.title: No DEI in DC Act
bills.description: Repeals, amends and blocks D.C. from using funds to carry out laws, policies, offices and commissions related to diversity, equity and inclusion
